{{Day}}

==Events==
*[[1325]] &ndash; [[Afonso IV of Portugal|Alfonso IV]] becomes King of [[Portugal]].
*[[1558]] &ndash; [[France]] takes [[Siege of Calais (1558)|Calais]], the last continental possession of [[Kingdom of England|England]].
*[[1608]] &ndash; Fire destroys [[Jamestown, Virginia]].
*[[1610]] &ndash; [[Galileo Galilei]] makes his first observation of the four [[Galilean moons]]: [[Ganymede (moon)|Ganymede]], [[Callisto (moon)|Callisto]], [[Io (moon)|Io]] and [[Europa (moon)|Europa]], although he is not able to distinguish the last two until the following day.
*[[1782]] &ndash; The first American commercial bank, the [[Bank of North America]], opens.
*[[1785]] &ndash; Frenchman [[Jean-Pierre Blanchard]] and American [[John Jeffries]] travel from [[Dover|Dover, England]], to [[Calais|Calais, France]], in a gas [[balloon]].
*[[1797]] &ndash; The modern [[Flag of Italy|Italian flag]] is first used.
*[[1835]] &ndash; {{HMS|Beagle}} drops anchor off the [[Chonos Archipelago]].
*[[1894]] &ndash; [[William Kennedy Dickson]] receives a [[patent]] for [[film|motion picture film]].
*[[1904]] &ndash; The [[distress signal]] "[[CQD]]" is established only to be replaced two years later by "[[SOS]]".
*[[1919]] &ndash; [[Montenegro|Montenegrin]] guerrilla fighters [[Christmas Uprising|rebel]] against the planned annexation of Montenegro by [[Serbia]], but fail.
*[[1920]] &ndash; The [[New York State Assembly]] refuses to seat five duly elected [[Socialist Party of America|Socialist]] assemblymen.
*[[1922]] &ndash; [[Dáil Éireann]] ratifies the [[Anglo-Irish Treaty]] by a 64-57 vote.
*[[1927]] &ndash; The first transatlantic [[telephone]] service is established &ndash; from [[New York City|New York, New York]] to [[London|London, United Kingdom]].
*[[1931]] &ndash; [[Guy Menzies]] flies the first solo non-stop [[trans-Tasman]] flight (from [[Australia]] to [[New Zealand]]) in 11 hours and 45 minutes, crash-landing on New Zealand's [[Westland District|west coast]].
*[[1935]] &ndash; [[Benito Mussolini]] and French [[Foreign minister]] [[Pierre Laval]] sign the [[Franco-Italian Agreement]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[Winter War]]: The Finnish 9th Division [[Battle of Raate Road|stops and completely destroys]] the overwhelming Soviet forces on the Raate-Suomussalmi road.
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Battle of Bataan|siege]] of the [[Bataan Peninsula]] begins.
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: [[United Kingdom|British]] General [[Bernard Montgomery, 1st Viscount Montgomery of Alamein|Bernard Montgomery]] holds a press conference in which he claims credit for victory in the [[Battle of the Bulge]].
*[[1948]] &ndash; [[Kentucky Air National Guard]] pilot Thomas Mantell crashes while [[Mantell UFO incident|in pursuit of]] a supposed [[unidentified flying object|UFO]].
*[[1954]] &ndash; [[Georgetown-IBM experiment]]: the first public demonstration of a [[machine translation]] system, is held in New York at the head office of [[IBM]].
*[[1955]] &ndash; Contralto [[Marian Anderson]] becomes the first person of color to perform at the [[Metropolitan Opera]] in in [[Giuseppe Verdi]]'s ''[[Un ballo in maschera]]''.
*[[1959]] &ndash; The United States recognizes the new [[Cuba]]n government of [[Fidel Castro]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; The [[UGM-27 Polaris|Polaris missile]] is test launched.
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Surveyor Program]]: ''[[Surveyor 7]]'', the last spacecraft in the Surveyor series, lifts off from [[Spaceport Florida Launch Complex 36|launch complex 36A]], [[Cape Canaveral Air Force Station|Cape Canaveral]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; The [[Punjab Legislative Council (Abolition) Act, 1969]] comes into effect.
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Mark Essex]] fatally shoots 10 people and wounds 13 others at [[Howard Johnson's]] Hotel in [[New Orleans|New Orleans, Louisiana]], before being shot to death by police officers.
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Sino-Vietnamese War|Third Indochina War]] &ndash; [[Cambodian–Vietnamese War]]: [[Phnom Penh]] falls to the advancing [[Vietnam]]ese troops, driving out [[Pol Pot]] and the [[Khmer Rouge]].
*[[1980]] &ndash; U.S. President [[Jimmy Carter]] authorizes legislation giving $1.5 billion in loans to bail out the [[Chrysler]] Corporation.
*[[1984]] &ndash; [[Brunei]] becomes the sixth member of the [[Association of Southeast Asian Nations]] (ASEAN).
*[[1985]] &ndash; [[Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency]] launches [[Sakigake]], Japan's first [[Robotic spacecraft|interplanetary spacecraft]] and the first deep [[space probe]] to be launched by any country other than the United States or the Soviet Union.
*[[1989]] &ndash; Prince [[Akihito]] is sworn in as the emperor of Japan after the death of his father [[Hirohito]]
*[[1990]] &ndash; The interior of the [[Leaning Tower of Pisa]] is closed to the public for safety reasons.
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Roger Lafontant]], former leader of the [[Tonton Macoute]] in [[Haiti]] under [[François Duvalier]], attempts a [[coup d'état]], which ends in his arrest.
*[[1993]] &ndash; The [[History of Ghana#Recent events|Fourth Republic of Ghana]] is inaugurated with [[Jerry Rawlings]] as President.
*  1993   &ndash; [[Bosnian War]]: The [[Armed Forces of Bosnia and Herzegovina|Bosnian Army]] executes a [[Kravica attack (1993)|surprise attack]] on the village of Kravica in [[Srebrenica]].
*[[1999]] &ndash; The Senate trial in the [[Impeachment of Bill Clinton|impeachment]] of U.S. President [[Bill Clinton]] begins.
*[[2005]] &ndash; The [[St Lawrence Lime]] is blown over in high winds.
*[[2010]] &ndash; Muslim gunmen in [[Egypt]] [[Nag Hammadi massacre|open fire]] on a crowd of [[Copts|Coptic Christians]], killing eight of them and one Muslim bystander.
*[[2012]] &ndash; A [[hot air balloon]] [[2012 Carterton hot air balloon crash|crashes]] near [[Carterton, New Zealand]], killing all 11 people on board.
